âš ï¸ Metric disambiguation: Google reports two different metrics. The "All Surfaces" number (~50T/day) includes Search AI Overviews, Gemini App, Workspace, and Cloud API. The "API only" number (~14.4T/day) is just direct Cloud API customers. GATT uses the "All Surfaces" number for apple-to-apple comparison with ByteDance, who also reports total service volume.
Methodology

How We Estimate Google Gemini

Primary method: Direct financial disclosure. Sundar Pichai has disclosed tokens/minute and tokens/month figures in multiple earnings calls (Q2, Q3, Q4 2025). These are the most reliable data points for any vendor.

Three disclosure datapoints: May 2025 (480T/mo), July 2025 (980T/mo), October 2025 (1,300T/mo). Growth trajectory: +104% (Mayâ†’Jul), +33% (Julâ†’Oct) â€” clearly decelerating.

Extrapolation: From Oct 2025 to Feb 2026 (4 months), we apply +5%/mo (conservative, reflecting deceleration trend). 43T Ã— 1.055^4 â‰ˆ 53T. We round to ~50T for the mid estimate.

Search AI Overviews contribution: Google's unique position includes ~1.1-1.8B AI Overview triggers daily (13% of global searches). Each trigger generates ~2,000-5,000 tokens. This alone accounts for ~2-9T/day â€” a volume source no other vendor has.

Reasoning model inflation: Gemini 2.5 Flash and other reasoning models consume ~17Ã— more tokens per request than standard models. This "thinking token" inflation applies across all vendors but may disproportionately affect Google's all-surfaces count.
